page.title: 01REVIEW OF BAYSTON HILL
page.content: The block is predominately agricultural and crossed by several minor roads that pass through the villages of Hook-a-gate, Annscroft, Longden and Bayston Hill and serve outlying farms and houses. Bayston Hill is now a suburb of Shrewsbury.The development of the village has taken place on the opposite side of the A49 from the original village leaving it isolated. It is a commuter village with most people working in Shrewsbury. Lyth Hill is a local beauty spot offering a superb panorama of the surrounding area. Farming is mainly arable with wheat as the main crop.There is very little permanent pasture. The few business concerns other than shops are outside our area.
